Question_1.Context: The study investigated the response of biochar on rhizosphere soil chemical properties, enzyme activity, microbial communities, and sugarcane Pokkah boeng disease.
Question_1.Question: What was the effect of applying 30 t ha−1 of biochar on soil pH compared to applying 15 t ha−1 of biochar?
Question_1.Source: The amendment of 30 t ha−1 of biochar (B2) significantly improve soil pH by 1.50% and 9.61% compared with that of B1 and B0, followed by 0.51% increase by 15 t ha−1 of biochar (B1) compared with that of control (B0).

Question_2.Context: The study focused on the impact of biochar on enzyme activities in the rhizosphere soil of sugarcane.
Question_2.Question: Which enzyme activity significantly increased with biochar application?
Question_2.Source: The application of biochar significantly increased S-UE, S-SC, and S-ACP activities.

Question_3.Context: The study explored the impact of biochar on the microbial community in the sugarcane rhizosphere.
Question_3.Question: What was the effect of biochar application on the diversity and richness of rhizosphere microorganisms?
Question_3.C: No effect on diversity and richness
Question_3.D: Varied effect on diversity and richness
Question_3.Source: Alpha diversity analysis showed that biochar application significantly changed the diversity and richness of rhizosphere microorganisms.

Question_4.Context: The study investigated the correlation between soil chemical properties and microbial community in the sugarcane rhizosphere.
Question_4.Question: Which soil chemical property showed a positive correlation with the relative abundance of Proteobacteria?
Question_4.Source: AK and S-ACP were positively correlated with the phylum Proteobacteria.

Question_5.Context: The study examined the impact of biochar on disease index of Pokkah boeng disease in sugarcane.
Question_5.Question: How did the disease index of PB in the biochar-treated groups compare to the control groups?
Question_5.D: Varied between biochar-treated and control groups
Question_5.Source: Biochar application reduced the disease index of PB. The disease index of PB was lower in biochar-treated groups than in the control groups.

Question_6.Context: The study analyzed the relative abundance of Fusarium in the sugarcane rhizosphere with and without biochar application.
Question_6.Question: What was the effect of biochar application on the relative abundance of Fusarium in the rhizosphere?
Question_6.A: Increased the relative abundance of Fusarium
Question_6.B: Decreased the relative abundance of Fusarium
Question_6.C: No effect on the relative abundance of Fusarium
Question_6.D: Varied effect on the relative abundance of Fusarium
Question_6.Source: Biochar significantly reduced the relative abundance of Fusarium in the sugarcane rhizosphere.

Question_7.Context: The study explored the impact of biochar on the enrichment of specific microbial communities in the sugarcane rhizosphere.
Question_7.Question: Which microbial community was enriched in the treatment group with 30 t ha−1 of biochar?
Question_7.Source: Acidobacteriota (phylum and its class Vicinamibacteria, genus Vicinamibacterales) was enriched in the treatment group where 30 t ha−1 biochar was applied.

Question_8.Context: The study investigated the co-occurrence network between environmental factors and bacterial phyla in the sugarcane rhizosphere.
Question_8.Question: Which environmental factor was positively correlated with HSB_OF53-F07 (Chloroflexi)?
Question_8.Source: The results showed a negative correlation of HSB_OF53-F07 (Chloroflexi) with AP and S-ACP.

Question_9.Context: The study analyzed the impact of biochar on the soil microbial community and its correlation with soil environmental factors.
Question_9.Question: Which enzyme activity showed a significant positive correlation with Kickxellomycota in the fungal community?
Question_9.Source: S-UE was significantly positive correlated with Kickxellomycota.

Question_10.Context: The study examined the impact of biochar on the co-occurrence network between environmental factors and fungal phyla in the sugarcane rhizosphere.
Question_10.Question: Which fungal phylum was negatively correlated with both NH4 +–N and AK?
Question_10.Source: Neocosmospora (Ascomycota) and Cephalotrichum (Ascomycota) were negatively correlated with NH4 +–N and AK.
